results.definition: a small piece or quantity of something
examples: a spot of tea
a bit of paper
a bit of lint
I gave him a bit of my mind

results.definition: a small fragment of something broken off from the whole
examples: a bit of rock caught him in the eye
wait just a moment
in a mo
it only takes a minute
in just a bit
it was a nice piece of work
he had a bit of good luck

results.definition: piece of metal held in horse's mouth by reins and used to control the horse while riding
examples: the horse was not accustomed to a bit

results.definition: a unit of measurement of information (from binary + digit); the amount of information in a system having two equiprobable states
examples: there are 8 bits in a byte

results.definition: a small amount of solid food; a mouthful
examples: all they had left was a bit of bread
overheard snatches of their conversation

results.definition: a short theatrical performance that is part of a longer program
examples: he did his act three times every evening
she had a catchy little routine
it was one of the best numbers he ever did

results.definition: the part of a key that enters a lock and lifts the tumblers
the cutting part of a drill; usually pointed and threaded and is replaceable in a brace or bitstock or drill press
examples: he looked around for the right size bit

results.definition: to grip, cut off, or tear with or as if with the teeth or jaws
examples: Gunny invariably tried to bite her

results.definition: cause a sharp or stinging pain or discomfort
examples: The sun burned his face

results.definition: penetrate or cut, as with a knife
examples: The fork bit into the surface
A bee stung my arm yesterday
